chunk_text: Aid / Scholarships / Undergraduate Scholarships Undergraduate Scholarships Freshman Scholarships & Financial Aid offers scholarships for incoming freshman admitted to the Fall term. You may apply for all University level scholarships through the Common App . Students must also submit a Self-Reported Academic Record (SRAR) in order to be considered for freshman scholarships. The scholarship deadline for Fall is December 1*. You must provide consent for application data to be used for scholarship

chunk_text: Texas Armed Services Scholarship Program Welch Scholars Continuing Students Scholarships & Financial Aid offers scholarships for continuing students. You may apply for all University-level scholarships through the University Scholarship Application . Students should also submit an aid application to

context: This chunk provides information about the application process and selection criteria for continuing student scholarships at Texas A&M University.
chunk_text: Students should also submit an aid application to be considered for scholarships that require financial need. The University Scholarship Application deadline is February 1. Your grades are only one of many components considered in the review process. Additional factors for selection include, but are not limited to your leadership, community service, special talents, first generation college status, admittance to an education abroad program and academic achievement under difficult circumstances.

International Student Scholarships Scholarship Programs Century Scholars Program Established in 1999, the Century Scholars Program is a partnership between Texas A&M University and 110 under-represented Texas high schools to enroll and retain top students from each school. context: The document discusses various undergraduate scholarships offered by Texas A&M University, including the Greater Texas Foundation (GTF) Aggie Scholars Program and the National Scholars program.
chunk_text: The Greater Texas Foundation (GTF) Aggie Scholars Program is designed to assist graduates of early college high school programs in attaining their degree from Texas A&M University. The Aggie Scholars Program is funded by the Greater Texas Foundation, a statewide education grant maker, based in Bryan, Texas. Learn more about the GTF Aggie Scholars Program National Scholars Texas A&M University is consistently ranked among the top universities in the nation for National Scholar enrollment. Texas

Texas A&M is pleased to offer scholarship opportunities to College Station fall freshman admits who are identified as one of the best students in the nation, as either a National Merit Semifinalist or National Merit Finalist. Students who have multiple designations will only receive the scholarship offer that can lead to the highest valued scholarship package. context: The chunk describes the Regents' Scholars Program, which is a scholarship program at Texas A&M University designed to assist first-generation college students. It provides details on the scholarship amount and eligibility. This information is part of the broader section on undergraduate scholarships offered by Texas A&M University.
chunk_text: Regents' Scholars Program First awarded in Fall 2004, the Regents' Scholarship is designed to assist first-generation college students in achieving their educational goals at Texas A&M University. Students who entered fall 2019 or earlier will receive up to $5,000 per year for up to four years. Students entering fall of 2020 or later will receive up to $6000 per year for up to four years. Learn more about the Regents' Scholarship State Scholarship Programs Freshman students Collegiate License

Howard and Nancy Terry were long-time residents of Houston, where Mr. Terry was successful in a variety of businesses, ranging from banking to oil and gas. In 1986, the Terry family decided to

context: This chunk provides information about the Terry Foundation Scholarship and the Texas Armed Services Scholarship, which are two of the scholarship programs offered at Texas A&M University.
chunk_text: oil and gas. In 1986, the Terry family decided to help young people to help themselves by setting up an educational foundation. Mr. Terry had always been grateful for the financial assistance that enabled him to go to college, so they decided to dedicate their time and resources to giving future generations of young people in Texas this same opportunity. context: The chunk describes the Texas Armed Services Scholarship (TASSP), which is a scholarship program offered at Texas A&M University to assist students from Texas who are committed to education and military service.
chunk_text: Texas Armed Services Scholarship (TASSP) has been created to assist promising students from the State of Texas who are committed to education and service. It encourages young leaders to participate in the Texas Army National Guard, the Texas Air National Guard, the Texas State Guard, the United States Coast Guard, the United States Merchant Marine, or to become commissioned officers in any branch of the armed services of the United States. Annually, the governor and the lieutenant governor may

chunk_text: the governor and the lieutenant governor may each appoint two students, and each state senator and each state representative may appoint one student to receive a conditional TASSP award. Learn more about the TASSP Scholarship Welch Scholars - Funded by the Finis Welch Foundation Finis Welch began funding scholarships at Texas A&M University in the fall of 2011. A resident of Bryan and Centerville, Texas, Finis was a world-renowned economist, a highly successful entrepreneur and an accomplished

context: This chunk provides information about the Welch Scholars program, which is a scholarship program at Texas A&M University funded by the Finis Welch Foundation. The program provides scholarships to high-achieving students who demonstrate financial need.
chunk_text: successful entrepreneur and an accomplished rancher. Finis Welch was the founder and sole benefactor of the Finis Welch Foundation.  The foundation was established in 2012 and reflects Finis' lifelong commitment to education by providing scholarships to high-achieving students who can demonstrate financial need.
